definition[0]: a grey powder made from lime and clay that becomes hard when it is mixed with water and allowed to dry, and that is used in building
definition[1]: a thick sticky substance that becomes very hard when it dries and is used for filling holes or sticking things together
definition[3]: to make a relationship between people, countries, or organizations firm and strong
example[1]: They want to cement a good working relationship between the government and trade unions.
